byline.contributor: Winnie Hu, Daniel E. Slotnik and Rebecca White contributed reporting. Elisa Cho contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The suspect, West Spruill, forced Ana Charle, 36, to undress in her car, chased her as she tried to flee and then shot her in the street, officials said.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Resident Kills Director of Bronx Shelter, Police Say
headline.main: Former Resident Kills Director of Bronx Homeless Shelter, Police Say

snippet: The suspect, West Spruill, forced Ana Charle, 36, to undress in her car, chased her as she tried to flee and then shot her in the street, officials said.
abstract: Ana Charle, director of Project Renewal Shelter in Bronx, is abducted and killed by West Spruill, former shelter resident with history of mental illness and violent behavior; Spruill had forced Charle to undress in her car and then opened fire as she fled naked down street; has been charged with second-degree murder and criminal possession of weapon; it is not yet known whether Charle was raped.
